column3: If only I could give ZERO stars. The exact same experience happened to me as Michelle below with the nasty rude owner refusing to resolve even the smallest of complaints. I was a longtime loyal customer and always loved the food

column5: so I just called and asked to see if they would refund / replace. The owner literally told me "no no you don't get a replacement or refund because this just means you don't like my cooking!!!" And then hung up on me. column6: and concerns me that there likely are significant health code violations being broken

When we called and asked them where the order was they said "in the kitchen" and that it would be another hour (we had already been waiting for an hour). We asked them to refund- and we had to fight to get it. They told us they would refund us but the charge showed up on our credit card statement. We've eaten there before and the food is just okay. Most importantly who wants to give a restaurant your money and be treated poorly? If you look through the Yelp reviews you'll see the common review is that this place has horrible customer service. column3: I recently wrote a rather blistering
column4: perhaps biased
column5: review of Hoboken as a city
column6: but one undeniably positive aspect of the Hoboken experience is that it has a multitude of restaurants; some great
column7: some good
column8: some not-so-good. It's not a big city
column9: but if you want...say...Italian--- there are easily a half-dozen or more Italian restaurants to choose from. Latino cuisine? Plenty of restaurants to choose from. Middle-Eastern? Yes; if not in Hoboken itself
column10: then in the immediate vicinity. "Fast-food" deli style? It's there. "Fast food" Korean? It's there. Japanese? Yes. Peruvian? Colombian? Cuban? Of course.Where I work in Hoboken
column11: we've ordered so much take-out food over the past few years that we're given to calling ourselves "the Lunchbox Mafia." (Actually
column12: someone from another department rather snidely referred to a co-worker as "the Godfather of Lunch
column13: (Chuck) and it seemed a logical progression from there to Lunchbox Mafia." Anyway...) One type of cuisine we've had a problem with would be Chinese. Not that Hoboken is lacking Chinese restaurants. We tried several different Chinese restaurants in the area
column14: but there was no uniformity in terms of our reactions to them. There's one restaurant that's cheap
column15: and they deliver fast. I loathe it
column16: but Luca Brasi (Lance) likes it. Another restaurant was pretty good
column17: but Tessio (Dave) found a cockroach in his order
column18: and that was the end of that one.Then someone recommended Lo Fatt Chow
column19: and we've all pretty much agreed that for Chinese
column20: this is going to be our "go-to" place for ordering take-out (although Luca Brasi will still continue ordering from the cheap place; there's no accounting for taste
column21: but who is gonna argue with Luca Brasi?). I usually order steamed vegetables with chicken
column23: and an egg roll. I always have to be very careful in ordering Chinese food
column25: if there's no MSG per se
column26: then the massive amount of just plain salt
column27: particularly in the soups; salt is a migraine trigger for me) will cause a migraine quicker than Clemenza (Alex) can gulp down an order of steamed dumplings
column28: and chicken wings. But I've never really been able to connect anything I've eaten at Lo Fatt Chow with migraines. Kay Corleone (Frances) orders from the dinner menu and gets the hot garlic chicken
column29: which she loves. Frankie Five Angels (Dwight) gets the chicken and broccoli
column30: and he's a fan.I've tried other dishes myself and been well satisfied; I've liked the Happy Family
column32: the Mei-Feng. I stay away from the soups because the salt content inherent in Chinese (and Japanese) soups always makes me nervous
column34: eating at Lo Fatt Chow has been an enjoyable
column36: and safe experience.The Godfather of Lunch approves.The only downside
column38: is the fact that they won't deliver before 5pm.When it comes to ordering Chinese food in Hoboken
column39: Lo Fatt Chow is a winner.

column7: "I told you
column8: our food is pre-made. NO!" This lady was uninterested in helping me and acted like I was genuinely a burden on her time. Also

If I could
column4: I would give Low-Fatt Chow 3.5 stars. My friends and I ordered for delivery. We went on the site and it said that it was too late to place an order. However
column5: it said the place closed at 10 and it was only 9. It was only .1 miles away so it should have been plenty of time. So we called and they had no problem fulfilling our order. The service was outstanding after that- the lady was very competent even though it was a big order. The food was average. Definitely a safe Chinese place but it wasn't overly flavorful. It came in a container with a divider so rice was on one side and the protein on the other. Not how I would have like it but the others thought it was nice.

column3: I've been coming here for a few months and the owner
column4: remembers my name most of the time (generally order the same items lol). The food is pretty good compared to the other Chinese places here. It's less greasy but still has a lot of favor and get a decent amt in your portion.

column3: This 5 star rating is for Hoboken people.   Among all the Chinese restaurants in Hoboken
column4: this place is by far the best in terms of the food being clean and not too oily and tasting really good. (Especially when the head chef makes it.)I ordered delivery multiple times and the food came really fast and promptly.   The only other Chinese restaurant that is comparable is Precious
column5: BUT Lo-Fatt-Chow is significantly better.  With the general Tso lunch combo I asked for chicken fried rice made with brown rice.  I was shocked at how clean the fried rice was made.  It wasn't drowned in oil.    So take a chance and order from this place!  Their lunch portions are great too.

column3: Delicious and healthy Chinese food that you can't find anywhere else! I hope that they consider expanding to other towns!

column3: I've actually ordered from this place several times and realized that I've never left a review. And I believe that should already speak for itself. I work nearby so I usually just order take-out and pick it up myself. The online ordering menu is very smooth and simple. The orders are prepared promptly. 99% of the time my order is waiting when I walk through the door. I heavily favor the Chicken and Broccoli in Garlic Sauce. The same order with Ginger sauce is great but I find the garlic sauce to be much tastier. Last night I had the General Tso's Chicken with Chicken Fried rice and that was also great. The portion sizes are pretty big and I often find myself splitting my meal into two.As I already mentioned this is my "go to" place when I am working in the area. I enjoy the food and the prompt service. So I will continue to order from here!
FINALLYYYYYYY!!! Decent Chinese food in Hoboken that tastes good and doesn't make you feel disgusted with all the grease!
Finally a delicious
column4: reliable (I'm looking at you rice shop) Chinese take out in Hoboken. The portions are great for the dinner combo under $10 and all the food is very fresh. It's not doused in sauce and grease with a touch of noodles. Hope they're here to stay.

column3: Someone needs to start a food truck and start selling the wraps that they have here because they are really good and I am sure people would buy them!I ordered a Peking Duck whole wheat wrap which had "Chinese coleslaw" (which doesn't have mayo apparently)
column4: some kind of sauce (I assume Peking Duck sauce)
column5: and a choice of lo-mein
column6: brown rice
column7: fried rice
column8: or white rice. I didn't realize the side option would be inside of the wrap so I asked for lo-mein but it actually was quite good. They also have sesame chicken
column11: and buffolo chicken wraps available.As I mentioned
column12: I thought putting these ingredients into a wrap made a lot of sense. The duck sauce was a little too sweet but it was balanced by the coleslaw. I did find one small bone in the wrap but I think mistakes can happen and I was able to realize it was there. I haven't tried the other options here but I would order again as I enjoyed the food. I would add that the noodles in particular that were in my wrap seemed a little greasy so I don't know how healthy it is but they don't use MSG and such which is at the very least a bonus.

column3: I've been living in Hoboken for 8 years and this is the best Chinese food I've had! My husband and I have ordered from here quite a bit and food has always been fresh and delicious. Online ordering is a breeze and they arrive within 30-40min. Check this place out!

column4: I finally found my go-to Chinese restaurant. Ordering - super simpleDelivery - insanely fastFood - very tasty

Ordered delivery from here tonight seeking to try something new and I was pleasantly surprised. I got the dinner combo with hot garlic chicken
column4: fried rice and hot and sour soup. Added the Asian spring roll to meet the $10 minimum for delivery. Ten bucks for all that food. What?! I couldn't even eat half of it and I'm stuffed which is surprising because I am a big eater. Leftovers will be tomorrow's dinner and I will enjoy every bite. Everything was great and I don't feel gross after eating it which is a first for having Chinese food. To top it all off the delivery guy (with cool funky hair) arrived in 30 minutes on the dot and everything was piping hot. I'll definitely be ordering from here again when I get my occasional Chinese food craving.

column3: Warning - This is a review solely based off the customer service! Went in to order some food and walked in to the owner yelling at one of the staff members. We wanted to know what ingredients were part of the veggie dumplings and the owner responded in a remarkably snappy tone saying "mixed vegetables" and when we asked her to specify what types since we have some allergies
column4: she merely said "just order something off the menu that you can see". I found that to be a rather obnoxious response! As the owner shouldn't you know the food you are selling; whether it was laziness in not wanting to converse with customers or mere ignorance at the type of food being sold - either way
column5: that's not how you grow a business!Oh and now a review on the dumplings - we ordered the chicken dumplings which were super doughy and not very flavorful! Well this place was definitely a Debbie downer! On to the next spot!

column3: Wow. Just wow. My first time coming here

She asked the owner (standing right next to all of us) to explain what are in the vegetable dumplings
column5: to which her response was sour at best. She (the owner) said she didn't know what's in the vegetable dumplings and that if I have an allergy I should "order what I can see on the menu"...her words. Given the height of allergies and dietary restrictions in today's society
column6: that is not an acceptable answer. I was happy to see the western end of Hoboken getting developed with new establishments

I love their wonton soup though and their sweet and sour soup is good too.  My husband likes their spare ribs. Their lunch special is priced well and it's a good amount of food. column3: Alright I live across the street so this might be somewhat self-serving as I'd like to see Lo-Fatt do well :)Healthier Chinese is a great concept and this place executes it very well. You will notice a lack of starch and sodium immediately yet the food is delicious. Case in point: the hot and sour soup. I am sure there are many aficionados out there. Try this one!  I have ordered 10 meals already and  haven not been disappointed. The summer rolls are sizable and delish. When I order later in the evening I get the tofu vegetable soup. I love it because of the fresh ingredients and you can probably count the calories on one hand (ok maybe not quite that low).As a sidebar
